content: Hey all, I was thinking of moving Cargo's CI over to github actions since it's a bit nicer to work with than Azure. In doing so this would require us to update the bors configuration and the bors configuration with github actions seems a bit wonky (weird builders that are conditionally skipped and such). I was wondering if perhaps the new bors-rs made it a bit more convenient to configure a repo? Or additionally, if infra is interested for a guinea pig in the Rust project for bors-rs the cargo team would be happy to sacrifice ourselves volunteer.
bors-rs is still really early in development, I wouldn't count on it being ready soon
but we'll keep in mind cargo when we'll need to start testing it :)
Is there docs on how bors-rs is set up or what people can do to contribute?
we should transfer the repo from Brandon Williams's personal account to the bors-rs org soon
but atm it has no docs in it
